pages.text:
January 30, 2024
The Butcher Family names Naples artist Paul Arsenault winner of The Clyde Butcher: A Better Florida Award
Contact: Sally Wilson
Development Director & Special Events
The Alliance for Florida’s National Parks
(239) 237-7558
The Butcher Family names Naples artist Paul Arsenault winner of The Clyde Butcher: A Better Florida Award
(Naples, FL.) – This year’s Wine & Wildlife event hosted by The Alliance for Florida’s National Parks, the official philanthropic partner for Florida’s four national parks, is set for February 13, 2024, at the Naples Sailing & Yacht Club from 5:30 p.m. to 8 p.m.
The Alliance is proud to announce the choice of Paul Arsenault, noted Naples artist, as the recipient for the “The Clyde Butcher: A Better Florida Award,” established in 2021, created after Southwest Florida’s renowned photographer, Clyde Butcher.
When the Wine & Wildlife committee visited Paul to inform him that he was selected as the winner, he informed us that it was coincidentally the 50th anniversary of his becoming a Naples artist. Born in Montreal, Paul grew up near the sea in Hingham, MA. After graduating from The Art Institute of Boston in 1973, he spent 6 months as a deckhand on a research vessel which eventually brought him to Florida.
He arrived in Naples in 1974, and since then, has called Naples his home. It also serves as his base for extensive painting junkets to the Caribbean, Central and South America, Asia, the South Pacific, Indonesia, Australia, Hawaii, the Middle East, and Europe.
Along with travel, annual fundraising shows have been a hallmark of his career and as of 1983,  have benefited a variety of non-profit organizations devoted to health, environmental protection, and historic preservation. His lifelong pursuit to capture the essence of a location, particularly coastal communities, is enhanced by his passion for history and his natural storytelling ability.
Paul’s paintings are available for viewing at his studio in Old Naples. For appointments call 239-263-1214 or by email paul@paularsenault.art.com
Gulfshore Life Magazine is Wine & Wildlife’s exclusive magazine sponsor. Sponsorships, tickets, and table sales are currently underway, go to https://handbid.app.link/wineandwildlife

Make an Impact to Support Florida's National Parks

Corporate Opportunities
Your Name At The Parks
Current Donors
New row for space with increased height
Together, we ensure that our state’s greatest natural ecosystems are preserved and protected for generations to come.
As the official philanthropic partner for the Everglades, Dry Tortugas and Biscayne National Parks and Big Cypress National Preserve, by donating to The Alliance you support the national parks that you love and you help us bring their greatness to others throughout Florida – and beyond. Together we can ensure we have accessible and vibrant national parks for today and future generations to enjoy.
We are a 501(c)(3) organization and all donations to The Alliance are tax-deductible, to the full extent allowed by the IRS.
There are many ways to make a monetary donation to The Alliance:
Call
us at (305) 665-4769
Send
a check to:
1172 S. Dixie Highway, #470
Coral Gables, FL 33146

the form to the right:

June 14, 2024
Exciting News: Grant Award from Arthrex Charitable Giving Supports SWAMP Program!
We are thrilled to announce that The Alliance for Florida’s National Parks has received a generous $5,000 grant from Arthrex Charitable Giving to support the Swamp Water And Me Program (SWAMP) at Big Cypress National Preserve. This funding will enable us to continue offering this impactful program, which provides every 6th-grade student in Collier County the opportunity to explore and experience the natural wonders of Big Cypress for a day.
About the SWAMP Program
The SWAMP program is a curriculum-based enrichment activity designed to introduce students to the unique ecosystems of Big Cypress National Preserve. The program begins in the classroom with a visiting ranger who prepares the students for their field trip. On the day of the trip, students travel by bus to the preserve where they engage in hands-on, interdisciplinary activities that foster a deeper understanding and appreciation of the natural world.
While in the swamp, students explore three distinct habitats—cypress swamp, open prairie, and pineland. They use radio-telemetry equipment to track a Florida panther (represented by a beanie baby), conduct water quality tests, take soil samples, record weather conditions, and identify local flora and fauna. This immersive experience transforms students into scientists for the day, enhancing their observation and analytical skills.
Impact of the SWAMP Program
The SWAMP program aims to provide students with hands-on, curriculum-based field experiences that help them understand their connections and responsibilities to the environment. The program’s goals include:
Offering interdisciplinary learning that leads to lifelong environmental stewardship.
Instilling a new environmental ethic in students through inquiry-based learning.
Demonstrating the positive effects of nature exposure on children’s physical, emotional, cognitive, and social development, including stress reduction and improved attention spans.
With a 19-year reputation for success, the SWAMP program has been a leader in environmental education in the region. It has consistently demonstrated significant learning gains and has great potential for long-term positive outcomes.
About Arthrex
Arthrex is a global medical device company and leader in new product development and medical education in orthopedics. Headquartered in Naples, Florida, Arthrex is committed to improving patient outcomes and advancing minimally invasive surgical techniques. Their charitable giving program focuses on supporting education, community development, and environmental sustainability initiatives.
Thank You, Arthrex!
We are deeply grateful to Arthrex Charitable Giving for their generous support of the SWAMP program. Their contribution will ensure that thousands of 6th-grade students in Collier County can continue to benefit from this transformative educational experience. Together, we are fostering a new generation of informed citizens, community leaders, and environmental stewards dedicated to preserving the fragile and unique ecosystems of South Florida.
For more information about Arthrex and their commitment to community and environmental sustainability, please visit Arthrex.

Members Outing: Sunset Bike Ride in Shark Valley
March 18, 2017 @ 6:00 pm
-
9:00 pm
Event header
Navigation

Family Fun Fest at Biscayne National Park
Members Outing: Big Cypress Orchid Walk
»
#tribe-events-header
Event featured image, but exclude link
Event content
Join the SFNPT for a twilight bike ride this month at Shark Valley, one of two Experience Your Backyard programs for members in March.
We’ll gather at the Shark Valley Visitor Center and ride to the park’s observation tower in time for sunset (15 miles roundtrip).
The program is free for members and guests, but space is limited.
Participants must reserve ahead, and bring their own bikes. Helmets required for children 16 and under.
Contact Jessica at jessica@southfloridaparks.org or 305-665-4769 to reserve space.

June 17, 2024
Bass Pro Shops Awards $10,000 Grant to Support Educational Programs!
We are grateful to Bass Pro Shop for a generous $10,000 grant! This support will help fund our educational programs across four of Florida’s national parks: Everglades, Biscayne, Dry Tortugas, and Big Cypress National Preserve.
Our Educational Programs
Thanks to this grant, over 75,000 kids have participated in our programs this year. Here’s a glimpse of what programs we’ve helped fund:
Everglades National Park
Junior Ranger Program: Kids learn about the Everglades through fun activities.
School Field Trips: Students explore unique habitats and wildlife.
Writing Expedition: High schoolers express their experiences through creative writing.
Biscayne National Park
Marine Biology Workshops: Teaching kids about coral reefs and marine ecosystems.
Seagrass Adventures: Exploring underwater worlds and the importance of seagrasses.
Dry Tortugas National Park
Coral Reef Education: Hands-on learning about coral conservation.
Fort Jefferson Tours: Historical insights and exploration of the fort.
Big Cypress National Preserve
SWAMP Program: 6th graders become “scientists for a day,” conducting tests and tracking wildlife.
Ranger-Led Field Trips: Interactive learning experiences in diverse habitats.
Get Involved
The Alliance for Florida’s National Parks is dedicated to preserving these beautiful spaces and educating our community. With Bass Pro Shops’ support, we can continue to offer these enriching programs.
ChatGPT can make mistakes. Check important info.

November 23, 2023
Yamaha Awards Grant of $22,806 to The Alliance for Florida’s National Parks
Donation Supports Volunteer Trail Patrol Program in Big Cypress as Part of Ongoing Effort to Encourage Safe, Responsible Riding and Sustainable, Open Riding Areas Inside of Big Cypress National Preserve.
Miami, FL – November 23, 2023
The Alliance for Florida’s National Parks is thrilled to announce that Yamaha has awarded a generous grant of $22,806 to support the Volunteer Trail Patrol Program in Big Cypress National Preserve. This crucial funding will be used to enhance the safety, responsibility, and sustainability of riding areas within the preserve. The primary objective of the Volunteer Trail Patrol Program is to have volunteers on the trails to assist with restoring, monitoring, and maintaining the expansive trail system located within the preserve’s boundaries.
“Yamaha’s grant will provide our organization with the necessary funds to get the Volunteer Trail Patrol program back up and running. We are excited to get out into the preserve and help provide access to visitors,” said CEO Jamie Diptee-Bay.
For more information about Yamaha’s Outdoor Access Initiative, visit:
http://www.YamahaOAI.com
For more information about The Alliance for Florida’s National Parks, visit:

As dedicated supporters of The Alliance for Florida’s National Parks, you are cordially invited to join us for the VIP preview night on December 4th....
